content.question: Which of the following Lewis diagrams represents a molecule that is polar?

choices.label: The figure presents a Lewis diagram. A Boron atom is bonded to three Fluorine atoms, located to the left, above, and below it, by single bonds. Each Fluorine atom has three nonbonding pairs of electrons.
The figure presents a Lewis diagram. A Carbon atom is bonded to two Oxygen atoms, located to its left and right, by double bonds. Each Oxygen atom has two nonbonding pairs of  electrons.

The figure presents a Lewis diagram. A Carbon atom is bonded to two Hydrogen atoms, located above and to the right of it, by single bonds. The Carbon atom is also bonded to two Chlorine atoms, located below and to the left of it, by single bonds. Each Chlorine atom has three nonbonding pairs of electrons on it.
The figure presents a Lewis diagram. There are two Nitrogen atoms bonded to one another by a triple bond. Each nitrogen atom has one nonbonding pair of electrons.

content.answer: The figure presents a Lewis diagram. A Carbon atom is bonded to two Hydrogen atoms, located above and to the right of it, by single bonds. The Carbon atom is also bonded to two Chlorine atoms, located below and to the left of it, by single bonds. Each Chlorine atom has three nonbonding pairs of electrons on it.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
